result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence J Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation>$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 16CF251. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Joint & Several. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain part-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim.  Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Not handle any money, checks or credit cards of any person but his own.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; counsel offer agreement for plea and request to set SEH; Ct conducts colloquy with defn; defn pleads guilty; Ct adjudicates defn guilty; bail continued & amended to add conditions; Ct set SEH; Ct adjourned.

CASH BOND CONDITIONS AMENDED ($1000 cash bail previously posted):
CASH BOND SET - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any of the individuals in the spreadsheet attached to the Criminal Complaint, Detrell G., Kehonna G and Katina H. and any victims.
- Defendant shall not be at Summit Credit Union, Associated Bank, or Wells Fargo location.
- Defendant shall not participate in the solicitations of any public or door-to-door funds.
- Defendant shall not dispose of any real estate or assets over $500.00.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
